txt.en: Márus has told you that you must find the original chisel to have any hopes of dismantling the rune-stone trap.\n\nYou should find the original chisel.

The vision shows you an oval stone on this pedestal. This fourth stone must be out there somewhere, waiting for you to find it. You swear you can hear faint whispers, bidding you to look closer at the illusion.
'Do you have the items? Remember, I need a Powerful fire-enchanted chisel, a Copper and obsidian rune-stone base, and a Polished dwarrowgleam.'

Márus has asked you for several ingredients to make a protective rune-stone.\n\nHis list included these items: powerful fire-enchanted chisel, copper and obsidian rune-stone base, polished dwarrowgleam.

'Hello, [placeholder]. What brings you all the way down here?'

You ask Márus if he knows anything about removing rune-stones set up as traps on doors and describe the state of the chamber you found.

'Oh ho, that's quite clever! You know, I have heard of some of our forefathers using rune-stones to protect their vaults from intruders. Aye, let me try to remember the specifics.'

He spends a few minutes mumbling to himself, lost in thought.

'Right! I remember now! I should be able to help you, but it will be tricky! To dismantle the trap, you will need a powerful rune-stone of your own to protect yourself from the searing flames. I can craft that for you with the right reagents, but, you will also need to track down the original chisel used to carve the rune-stone! Aye, the ancient dwarf-craft is not easily undone. Here, let me write this down for you. Good luck in your search. I fear a chisel that old may be gone forever!'

He quickly jots down a list on a piece of paper and hands it to you:

To Make Rune-stone:
- Powerful fire-enchanted chisel
- Copper and obsidian rune-stone base
- Polished dwarrowgleam

- Don't forget the original chisel!
The stones must be returned to their rightful places in the Crown Chamber.
The missing stone is out there somewhere, waiting to be found.

'Did you find the chisel?'

You show him the ancient chisel and hand over the rest of the items on his list. His eyes light up.

'By Durin's Beard! This truly is a chisel of the First Age! Just look at the craftsmanship! If nothing else, thank you for sharing this with me, [placeholder]. Ah, if only it were not so urgently needed. I will get started on your rune-stone now.'

He gets to work on the rune-stone. A short time later, it is complete.

'Here you are. This will protect you, and allow you to dismantle the rune-stone. Ah, to do that, all you need to do is hold the chisel directly in the middle of the stone, and hit it with something. A hammer, the base of a sword, anything heavy will do. It should be that simple!'
